verses.1: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
verses.2: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.
verses.3: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.
verses.4: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.
verses.5: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.
verses.6: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been Uriah’s wife.
verses.7: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.
verses.8: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.
verses.9: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.
verses.10: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.
verses.11: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.
verses.12: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.
verses.13: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.
verses.14: Azor became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.
verses.15: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.
verses.16: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
verses.17: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.
verses.18: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this: After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.19: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.
verses.20: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
verses.21: She shall give birth to a son. You shall name him Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”
verses.22: Now all this has happened that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
verses.23: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall give birth to a son. They shall call his name Immanuel;” which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”
verses.24: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;
verses.25: and didn’t know her sexually until she had given birth to her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.
